abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency
            Irrigation Rehabilitation Project for Afghanistan is to
            assist the Borrower in restoring irrigated agricultural
            production in rural areas, through improved, reliable water
            supply to rehabilitated irrigation schemes. The two key
            outcome indicators for the project development objective
            are: (i) incremental irrigated area resulting from
            rehabilitation of irrigation infrastructure; and (ii)
            increase in crop yields. Monitoring data show that as of
            October 31, 2010, the incremental irrigated area achieved
            was over 138,000 hectares compared to the end-of project
            target of 145,000 hectares. The latest annual crop survey
            carried out in 2010 also shows substantial increases
            (ranging from 21 percent to 86 percent) in crop yields as
            compared to the control group. Another significant outcome
            of irrigation rehabilitation is that water related disputes
            have reduced by 50 percent to 95 percent in rehabilitated
            schemes. The total number of project beneficiaries now
            exceeds 600,000 people. The project closing date was
            extended by one year when the first additional financing was
            approved, and by a further two and a half years when the
            second additional financing was approved, resulting in a
            cumulative extension of three and a half years. The current
            closing date is March 31, 2011.
